prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in elementary school would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in elementary school would. Our school's girls volleyball team has 14 players, including a set of 3 triplets: Alicia, Amanda, and Anna.  In how many ways can we choose 6 starters if all three triplets are in the starting lineup?
solution: If all triplets are in the starting lineup, we are choosing the 3 remaining starters from 11 players, which can be done in  $\binom{11}{3} = \boxed{165}$ ways.
gpt_response:
To figure out how many ways we can choose 6 starters with all three triplets in the lineup, we first need to make sure Alicia, Amanda, and Anna are in the lineup. So that leaves us with 3 spots to fill with the remaining 11 players.

To find the number of ways to choose those 3 players from the remaining 11, we will use a combination formula. The formula is nCr = n! / r!(n-r)!. In this case, n = 11 and r = 3.

So, 11C3 = 11! / 3!(11-3)! = 11! / 3!8! = (11 x 10 x 9) / (3 x 2 x 1) = 990 / 6 = 165.

Therefore, there are 165 ways to choose the 3 additional starters once Alicia, Amanda, and Anna are already in the lineup. So overall, there are 165 ways to choose 6 starters with all three triplets in the lineup.
solution_prompt:
Yes or no, is the final solution obtained in the following equal to 165?: To figure out how many ways we can choose 6 starters with all three triplets in the lineup, we first need to make sure Alicia, Amanda, and Anna are in the lineup. So that leaves us with 3 spots to fill with the remaining 11 players.

To find the number of ways to choose those 3 players from the remaining 11, we will use a combination formula. The formula is nCr = n! / r!(n-r)!. In this case, n = 11 and r = 3.

So, 11C3 = 11! / 3!(11-3)! = 11! / 3!8! = (11 x 10 x 9) / (3 x 2 x 1) = 990 / 6 = 165.

Therefore, there are 165 ways to choose the 3 additional starters once Alicia, Amanda, and Anna are already in the lineup. So overall, there are 165 ways to choose 6 starters with all three triplets in the lineup.
